text_recipes.name: Classic Beef Tacos
text_recipes.text:
Classic Beef Tacos

Ingredients:
- 1 lb ground beef
- 1 packet taco seasoning
- 8 taco shells
- 1 cup shredded lettuce
- 1 cup shredded cheddar cheese
- 1/2 cup diced tomatoes
- 1/4 cup sour cream
- Salsa to taste

Instructions:
1. Brown the ground beef in a skillet over medium-high heat, breaking it up as it cooks.
2. Drain excess fat and add taco seasoning with 1/2 cup water.
3. Simmer for 5 minutes until sauce thickens.
4. Warm taco shells according to package directions.
5. Fill shells with beef and top with lettuce, cheese, tomatoes, sour cream, and salsa.

Serves: 4
Prep time: 10 minutes
Cook time: 15 minutes

text_recipes.name: Honey Garlic Salmon
text_recipes.text:
Honey Garlic Glazed Salmon

Ingredients:
4 salmon fillets (6 oz each)
1/4 cup honey
3 tablespoons soy sauce
4 cloves garlic, minced
1 tablespoon olive oil
1 tablespoon lemon juice
Salt and pepper to taste
Fresh parsley for garnish

Directions:
1. Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).
2. Mix honey, soy sauce, garlic, and lemon juice in a small bowl.
3. Season salmon with salt and pepper.
4. Heat olive oil in an oven-safe skillet over medium-high heat.
5. Sear salmon skin-side up for 3 minutes.
6. Flip salmon and pour honey garlic mixture over top.
7. Transfer to oven and bake 10-12 minutes until salmon flakes easily.
8. Garnish with parsley and serve.

Nutrition per serving: 350 calories, 35g protein, 18g carbs, 12g fat
Difficulty: Easy
Time: 25 minutes

text_recipes.name: Vegetable Stir Fry
text_recipes.text:
Quick Vegetable Stir Fry

Ingredients:
2 cups broccoli florets
1 red bell pepper, sliced
1 cup snap peas
2 carrots, julienned
3 cloves garlic, minced
1 inch ginger, grated
3 tbsp soy sauce
1 tbsp sesame oil
1 tbsp rice vinegar
1 tsp cornstarch
2 tbsp vegetable oil
Cooked rice for serving

Method:
1. Mix soy sauce, sesame oil, rice vinegar, and cornstarch. Set aside.
2. Heat vegetable oil in a wok over high heat.
3. Add garlic and ginger, stir 30 seconds.
4. Add carrots, cook 2 minutes.
5. Add broccoli, bell pepper, and snap peas.
6. Stir fry 4-5 minutes until crisp-tender.
7. Pour sauce over vegetables, toss to coat.
8. Serve immediately over rice.

Serves 4 | Prep: 15 min | Cook: 10 min | Vegetarian | Kid-friendly: 7/10
